page.title: 12Housing in Hawkchurch
page.content: Houses in and around Hawkchurch vary; there are stone built cottages, modern bungalows, arge farmhouses, family council houses and a beautiful manor house called Wylde Court. Wylde Court belonged to Thomas Moore and over the South porch you can see a coat of arms of the Moore family, the date 1593 and T>M> is engraved on a lead cistern. In 1700 the house was passed to Thomas Wyndham and in 1806 it was sold to the Viscount of Bridport. After 1806 it was tenanted by the farmers, the present inhabitant is Mr. Cole.
